Merge pull request #360 from jasonzzz/master

Fix a typo.
more docs, more sensible default for max bulk actions
improve feeder mode, sensible MySQL defaults restored, dropping unnecessary files from assembly
fix for stale metrics/suspend thread after river deletion
fix for null values in map, closes #344

custom refresh interval settings for bulk indexing

JDBC plugin 1.3.4.0
- breaking: parameters for Elasticsearch renamed and moved out of "jdbc" part of river definition
- breaking: no more docs indexed for river state, moved to cluster state
- feeder: improved standalone feeder mode with multithreading and scheduling
- new: river can execute an array of river definitions concurrently by using "pipelines"
- new: column name map (useful for Oracle short column names)
- new: suspend/resume, closes #347
- update pom.xml profiles to latest driver versions (Derby, H2, hsqldb, MySQL, Postgresql)
- refactoring: most classes moved to package org.xbib.elasticsearch.plugin.jdbc
- pipeline architecture: a single river instance can execute multiple rivers concurrently
- RiverFlow class now threadsafe
- all source/mouth resources are closed between runs
- REST: river state actions, run river action
- bug fixes for river states stored at cluster metadata, closes #342, #353
- bug fix for handling null values, closes #344
- optional treating binary data as strings
- mysql/postgresql tests against "metawiki" data from http://dumps.wikimedia.org/metawiki/latest/
- cleaned up tests

Merge pull request #335 from Friss/master

Update readme to latest versions of es and plugin
Update readme to latest versions of es and plugin
wait for active bulk requests after a run

Stored procedure support

Add field name renaming in the register map.

Change of RiverSource API, the SQL command is passed through the result set processing
because it carries the callable statement register map information for the field
names.

first step to support stored procedures

Support for stored procedures added with tests for MySQL. The tests are taken from
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/jdbc/basics/storedprocedures.html

The out parameters can not be renamed to Elasticsearch field names right now, this will be done as a followup.
fix for broken river state API

Fixing broken feeder mode, update to ES 1.3.1

The feeder mode was broken due to wrong classpath control in the example shell scripts
and the river state move into the cluster state. Cluster state is not possible
to use in TransportClient, so a workaround was introduced to let the JDBC plugin
start also in a TransportClient.

More comments added at example shell scripts to clarify the use of feeder mode
in a JVM outside of an Elasticsearch node.

Update to Elasticsearch 1.3.1

An NPE in the river state getting should be fixed.

Dropping unused dependency of hamcrest matchers.

Fixing tests for derby/h2/hsqldb, adding timezone and locale configuration

All tests for simple and column strategy on memory open source databases should succeed now (derby, h2, hsqldb).

This commit updates also h2 and hsqldb versions.

Timezone and locale settings have been added, also a test for the $now parameter. GMT formatting of JDBC time value gets been replaced by timezone-sensitive formatting.

It is not tested now how locale settings will influence calender settings, but the method Calendar.getInstance(timezone, locale) is now used for JDBC set/get of time values.
update to Elasticsearch 1.3.0, no more support dependency, JDBC river state actions

Merge pull request #275 from schmorgs/master

Fix for timestamped indexes #272

Fix for timestamped indexed

This fixes an issue when using timestamped indexes via the "index_timestamp" parameter.

The index name is being set before the JODA timestamp pattern has been evaluated which means the index is created is a literal string.
e.g. index-YYYY-MM-dd instead of index-2014-06-28

To fix this, setTimeWindowed paremater is set before the index name is set in setIndex.

Merge pull request #129 from msathis/master

Check fields for json before treating them as normal strings. This allows us to mix normal fields with json fields.

Check fields for json before treating them as normal strings.

Right now jdbc river allows either _source field or normal fields.
There is no way of having both normal fields and json fields. This
commit fixes this issue by trying to convert each field to json if it
has valid json string.

Merge pull request #99 from hshiraishi/unittest_improvement

Unittest improvement

One more issue with unit tests: when passing a null value to the bind method, it binds as type "char", regardless of the table column type (SimpleRiverSource.java, line 655). This seems to cause problems for PostgreSQL (all other databases seem to handle ok). I changed the values in the TableRiverMouthTests class to non-null values for now; as a long-term solution, I think there should be a way to specify what type the values should be bound as.

minor fixes for unit tests:
  - removed unnecessary calls to startNode("1") (node already started in AbstractRiverNodeTest.createIndices(), and these extra calls lead to launching more and more elasticsearch nodes as the tests progress, leaving orphan nodes.
  - fixed a typo in testsuite-mysql SQL
  - added the "sql5" for h2/hsqldb/mysql/oracle/postgresql
  - added a "listener" that can log which test method it's executing, as well as fail the tests if a test parameter was not passed and therefore the test was skipped.
